item.title: Bypasses
item.description: By setting this to 127.0.0.1, forbidden 403 responses. Also, you can occasionally bypass rate limitations by changing the value of the header to another ip every-time you get rate-limited.

item.title: File Path Traversal
item.description: File path traversal vulnerabilities allow an attacker to read/write arbitrary files in a web server. This ability can be used to leak sensitive information or, in case of writing, can be used to escalate to OS Command injection.

item.title: OverTheWire Natas
item.description: natas0: in comments (gtVrDuiDfck831PqWsLEZy5gyDz1clto) natas1: in comments too (ZluruAthQk7Q2MqmDeTiUij2ZvWy2mBi) natas2: /files/users.txt (sJIJNW6ucpu6HPZ1ZAchaDtwd7oGrD14) natas3: /robots.txt (Z9tkRkWmpt9Qr7XrR5jWRkgOU901swEZ) natas4: Referrer header (iX6IOfmpN7AYOQGPwtn3fXpbaJVJcHfq) natas5: cookie loggedin (aGoY4q2Dc6MgDq4oL4YtoKtyAg9PeHa1) natas6: includes/secret.

item.title: SQL Injection
item.description: SQL injection vulnerabilities occur when developers fail to properly sanitise the parameters in an SQL query that are provided by users.

item.title: XSS Vectors
item.description: Split into multiple notes XSS Vectors XSS Vector Without Spaces, Using Throw This payload is taken from the portswigger academy lab.

item.title: XXE Injection
item.description: Split this into multiple notes XXE Injection The XML format allows users to specify entities which can be used inside the XML document using the formant &entityname;.
